title: Quotient to a Power Property
text: If a and $$b$$ are real numbers, $$b$$ is not zero, and $$m$$ is a counting number, then $${\left(\frac{a}{b}\right)}^m=\frac{a^m}{b^m}$$. For example, $${\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)}^2=\frac{1^2}{2^2}=\frac{1}{4}$$.
speech: If a and  b  are real numbers,  b  is not zero, and  m  is a counting number, then , parentheses a over b,  to the m-th is equal to fraction, a to the m-th, over, b to the m-th,  . For example, , parentheses 1 half  squared is equal to, fraction, 1 squared, over, 2 squared,  is equal to 1 fourth .
